channel.title: Car won't play burned cds?
channel.description: Ok, so I burned a CD on a cd-r and cd-rw.. both didn't work on my cars cd players so, I tried those cd's on a cd player and they worked. Ok, so I tried a CD that I bought on the car's cd player and it worked.. Is there some sort of software I can download that will burn them so that it will work on the cars cd player?

item.title: Car won't play burned cds?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

alright, glad that worked for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Car won't play burned cds?
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

I’ll try iTunes, Already tried using windows media player[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 01, 2009, 04:31:45 pm[/size][hr]Alright, I burned with iTunes using TDK CD-R 700mb cd’s and 4x speeds and it worked… Now I’m going to burn another cd with the Sony cd’s and then a faster speed and see what happens.

Read full topic

item.title: Car won't play burned cds?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

The most straightforward way for me would be to install itunes, make a playlist of the music with that, and then burn it using itunes.

The second best way is to open windows media player, click burn (for me it is in the top right, but I use windows 7), drag your folder of music into the burn list, insert the blank cd, and click start burn. Im pretty sure the way you are doing it right now is only setting up the cd to store the files, and not formatting it correctly to play the cd. Burning it with windows media player or itunes will fix the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Car won't play burned cds?
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“blah bah7, post:16, topic:311318”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=407758.msg3014348#msg3014348 date=1257083029]

Make sure that you aren’t making MP3 CDs. Mp3 CDs don’t work in most cars I know of, but they allow a single cd to hold far more songs. In iTunes you should get the choice of audio or mp3 cd.
[/quote]Alot of the early to mid-90’s cd players don’t support burned media at all.

So it looks like the problem is mp3 cd as opposed to audio cd.

@Starting Up, what were you using to burn your cds, were you drag and dropping or what?[/quote]Yes, I was opening up a folder of Mp3’s and Nero would convert the file into .cda’s…

Read full topic

item.title: Car won't play burned cds?
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

Alright guys, to keep updated. My friend stuck a burnt cd in my player… it worked… I was quite amazed as it was the same fuckin type cd’s (Sony cd-r 700mb)… So I stuck it in my computer and the files were .cda (cd format not mp3) so I downloaded Nero, I burned a cd at 8x speeds… Still didn’t work… But my the cd he burned was the whole cd… like he made a copy of a cd… so could that be why? Also, where do I buy 650mb cd’s cus they work and I went to 3 stores not find any…

Read full topic

item.title: Car won't play burned cds?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“blah bah7, post:11, topic:311318”]Oh ok, I don’t have one of those so i wouldn’t know that =P

Here, http://www.bestbuy.com/site/Car-Audio/Car+Stereos/abcat0302012.c?id=abcat0302012

Or search for a firmware upgrade for your audio system’s model… I’m not sure its possible but I’d try it.[/quote]It’s usually the hardware, not the firmware.

Read full topic
